why.title: Why Montreal Idea Jams?
why.thesis:
Most entrepreneurial community optimize for visibility.
We optimize for thinking before building.
why.p1: Entrepreneurship is usually discussed in rooms that demand confidence — designed for pitching, networking, or personal branding.
why.p2: But the most consequential moments happen earlier: when ideas are still fragile, trade-offs unclear, and the right path undecided.
why.p3: MIJ exists to make space for thinking out loud, challenging assumptions, embracing uncertainty, and learning directly from experienced builders.

jamExperience.title: What a Jam feels like?
jamExperience.p1:
You arrive with a drink— not a pitch.
Conversations start loosely, then sharpen around what matters.
jamExperience.p2: Most Jams center around an experienced builder, a founder actively building a new product or solution, or sometimes an expert invited to walk us through a specific question or problem.
jamExperience.p3: We think and learn together. You leave, not with a playbook, but with better questions, clearer instincts, and the quiet confidence that you’re not thinking alone.

past.title: Past MIJ conversations...
past.subtitle: Since April 2024, Montreal Idea Jams has gathered founders, operators, investors, and builders to explore what entrepreneurship actually feels like — beyond the pitch decks and growth metrics.

c1.title: Think Together
c1.body:
Slow down complex decisions.
Work through trade-offs, assumptions, and second-order effects — out loud, with people who care about getting it right.

c2.title: Sharpen Judgment
c2.body: Pressure-test ideas against reality. Replace narratives with clear reasoning, and intuition with mental models that have been tested in real markets, real teams, and real constraints.

c3.title: Build deliberately
c3.body:
Study real building processes.
How products, teams, and systems actually come together — constraints, sequencing, failures, and hard-earned lessons.

who.title: Who should join
who.description: People seriously thinking about entrepreneurship — whether they’re about to start, already building, or quietly questioning what comes next.

finalCta.title:
Come for the conversation.
Stay for the thinking.
